member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialogButton

member.summary: Instantiates a new custom button with an ID and a text.

Text label shown on the button. If you enable Command Links, a newline here separates the upper from the lower string on the button.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.CustomButton.Text

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.GlassHelper.HandleFormMovementOnGlass(System.Windows.Forms.Form,WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Margins)
member.summary: Adds a handler on the Form that enables the user to move the window around by clicking on a glass margin (or the title bar, as usual).
member.param: The form that will be controlled.
Margins of the glass sheet.
member.remarks: Eventual UI elements on the glass sheet will prevent the handler from receiving events (except the ThemeText control, which manually redirects mouse events to the form).

member.summary: Adds a handler on the Form that automatically paints the glass background black
member.param: The form that will be controlled.
Margins of the glass sheet.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.GlassHelper.HandleFormMovement
member.remarks: Handler will be kept alive by the event references on the form. As soon as the form is disposed, the handler will be disposed as well.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.GlassHelper.HandleBackground
member.remarks: Handler will be kept alive by the event references on the form. As soon as the form is disposed, the handler will be disposed as well.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Navigate(WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog)
member.summary: Creates a new Task Dialog setup and replaces the existing one. Note that the window will not be destroyed and that you should keep the existing TaskDialog reference (event handlers will still be registered). The existing Task Dialog will simply reset and use the options of the new one.
member.param: An instance of Task Dialog, whose settings will be copied into the existing dialog. You may safely destroy the nextDialog instance after use (do not register to events on it).

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.SetShieldButton(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds or removes an UAC Shield icon from a button.
member.param: Id of the button.
Sets whether to display a Shield icon or not.

member.param: True if the progress bar should be displayed in marquee mode (no explicit progress).

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.SetMarqueeProgressBar(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets whether the dialog's progress bar should be in standard or in marquee mode and sets its marquee speed.

Speed of the progress bar in marquee mode.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel
member.summary: A vertical panel which resembles what is used for information and navigation in the Control Panel of Windows 7 and Vista.
member.remarks: This control is meant to be used on the left hand side of a form, it creates a graphic border on the right hand side. Also I have VB code for this control if anyone needs it, just send me an e-mail at bpell@indiana.edu or blakepell@hotmail.com.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor
member.remarks:
We are by default setting the background color to Color.Transparent. The reason for this is that a lot of controls that will be used with this, namingly the Label and LinkLabel default their back color to the color of the panel and for those controls to display properly on this panel, their BackColor will need to be Color.Transparent (otherwise, they'll display as a black box). This should help to isolate the developer from having to research this.
To reduce flicker, especially when glass is enabled, I had to set all three of the below styles.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.OnControlAdded(System.Windows.Forms.ControlEventArgs)
member.summary: When a control is added, we will check the type and if it meets certain criteria will change some default behaviors of the control so that it fits our theme by default. The developer can still change this as they desire after it's added.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: The actual painting of the background of our control.
member.remarks: The colors in use here were extracted from an image of the Control Panel taken from a Windows 7 RC1 installation.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.RedrawControlAsBitmap(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This procedure will redraw any control, given it's handl as an image on the form. This is necessary if you want to lay this control on top of the glass surface of an Aero form.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Handles incoming Windows Messages.
member.remarks: On the paint event and if the RenderOnGlass is set to true, we will redraw the control as an image directly on the form. This has a little extra overhead but also provides the ability to lay this control directly on the glass and have it rendered correctly.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.RenderOnGlass
member.summary: Whether or not the control needs to be rendered on the Glass surface.
member.remarks: This is false by default, it should only be toggled to true if the control needs to lay directly on the glass surface of the form.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeText.ThemedLabel
member.summary: A Label containing some text that will be drawn with glowing border on top of the Glass Sheet effect.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeText.ThemedLabel.GlowSize
member.summary: Size of the glow effect around the text.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.Update(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the thumbnail's display settings.
member.param: Drawing region on destination window.
Origin region from source window.
Opacity. 0 is transparent, 255 opaque.
Visibility flag.
If true, only the client area of the window will be rendered. Otherwise, the borders will be be rendered as well.

Opacity. 0 is transparent, 255 opaque.
Visibility flag.
If true, only the client area of the window will be rendered. Otherwise, the borders will be be rendered as well.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider
member.summary: The labeled divider provides a Aero styled divider with an optional caption, similiar to what is seen in the Control Panel dialogs of Windows 7 and Vista.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: The actual painting of the background of our control.
member.remarks: The colors in use here were extracted from an image of the Control Panel taken from a Windows 7 RC1 installation.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerPosition
member.summary: The position of the divider line.
member.remarks: The default value is the center position which is consistent on how this type of divider has been used throughout the Windows 7 and Vista UI's.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerColor
member.summary: The color of the divider line.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.Text
member.summary: The text that should be used for the caption. If the caption is set to blank and the divider position is set to center then a simple divider line will be drawn.
member.remarks: After a change is made to the text property we want to invalidate the control so it triggers a new paint message being sent.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerPositions
member.summary: The positions that the divider line can be drawn in

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerPositions.Center
member.summary: The divider will be centered after the text caption and will begin drawing after the string. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerPositions.Below
member.summary: The divider will be drawn below the text caption.

True if the control should automatically update itself in case the thumbnailed form changes size or is closed.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window title and icon should be hidden.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window caption should be hidden altogether.
member.remarks: Should be set before handle creation.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager
member.summary: Main DWM class, provides Thumbnail registration, glass sheet effect and blur behind.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.Register(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Registers a thumbnail to be drawn on a Windows Form.
member.remarks: The thumbnail will not be drawn until you update the thumbnail's properties calling Update().
member.param: The Windows Form instance on which to draw the thumbnail.
The handle (HWND) of the window that has to be drawn.
member.returns: A Thumbnail instance, needed to unregister and to update properties.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.Register(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Registers a thumbnail to be drawn on a window.
member.remarks: The thumbnail will not be drawn until you update the thumbnail's properties calling Update().
member.param: The handle (HWND) of the window on which the thumbnail will be drawn.
The handle (HWND) of the window that has to be drawn.
member.returns: A Thumbnail instance, needed to unregister and to update properties.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.Unregister(WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail)
member.summary: Unregisters the thumbnail handle.
member.remarks: The handle is unvalid after the call and should not be used again.
member.param: A handle to a registered thumbnail.

Desired Flip 3D policy.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support Aero.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.SetDisallowPeek(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disallows Aero Peek on a window (or allows it).

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel
member.summary: A horizontal panel which resembles what is used for information and navigation in the Control Panel of Windows 7 and Vista.
member.remarks: This control is meant to be used on the left hand side of a form, it creates a graphic border on the right hand side. Also I have VB code for this control if anyone needs it, just send me an e-mail at bpell@indiana.edu or blakepell@hotmail.com.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor
member.remarks:
We are by default setting the background color to Color.Transparent. The reason for this is that a lot of controls that will be used with this, namingly the Label and LinkLabel default their back color to the color of the panel and for those controls to display properly on this panel, their BackColor will need to be Color.Transparent (otherwise, they'll display as a black box). This should help to isolate the developer from having to research this.
To reduce flicker, especially when glass is enabled, I had to set all three of the below styles.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.OnControlAdded(System.Windows.Forms.ControlEventArgs)
member.summary: When a control is added, we will check the type and if it meets certain criteria will change some default behaviors of the control so that it fits our theme by default. The developer can still change this as they desire after it's added.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: The actual painting of the background of our control.
member.remarks: The colors in use here were extracted from an image of the Control Panel taken from a Windows 7 RC1 installation.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.RedrawControlAsBitmap(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This procedure will redraw any control, given it's handl as an image on the form. This is necessary if you want to lay this control on top of the glass surface of an Aero form.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Handles incoming Windows Messages.
member.remarks: On the paint event and if the RenderOnGlass is set to true, we will redraw the control as an image directly on the form. This has a little extra overhead but also provides the ability to lay this control directly on the glass and have it rendered correctly.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.RenderOnGlass
member.summary: Whether or not the control needs to be rendered on the Glass surface.
member.remarks: This is false by default, it should only be toggled to true if the control needs to lay directly on the glass surface of the form.
